author: Arc13

text: @drezabek94 In general, an anime series' quality is inversely proportional to its length. Many popular shows have hundreds of episodes because their story is really just a placeholder, as the series was just designed to make money. The shows that are worth watching are much shorter because they are intended to tell a story properly -- a proper story doesn't drag on needlessly.
author: ・ω・

text: While this is an amazing piece, I have to suggest the manga over the anime because the latter is terribly melodramatic at times. The 'potato chip' scene is a pretty famous example. It's such a tightly-written series, so newcomers should give the printed form a chance. :)
author: ・ω・

text: @heyjeySigma Potato Chip actually is a very significant character in the show, have you even seen it? He's there in every episode up until his death.

text:
@SupraDarky Oh, that's sweet that you liked the soundtrack too, I thought I might've been the only one. And yeah, this was used in the Jealous scene, and it was quite powerful, since this was the bulk of its audio.

But, what about Light's Theme or Near's Theme? They're probably the popular choice, but Light's Theme is a pretty powerful song... oooh, no, L's Companions is my favorite one from the soundtrack, and that's not well known, or are you just not gonna post any more Death Note songs?

text: Since I wasn't at my house last week, I decided to watch Death Note on my laptop. I watched it all during the week and I loved it, I couldn't stop. Oh and please refrain from posting any spoilers, for those who didn't﻿ watch this anime yet I fully recommend it. The soundtrack is really good and while this isn't one of the more popular choices, I really like this theme. Makes me think of the Jealous/Gelus scene.
author: SupraDarky
